meanings.definition: A person who has flexible working hours.
meanings.sent1: As a flextimer, Sarah can choose when to start and finish work.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a new flextimer to manage the project deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The flextimer joked that they could work in their pajamas all day.
meanings.sent4: Being a flextimer is like being a time wizard, bending hours to fit your schedule.
meanings.sent5: The image of a flextimer juggling clocks symbolizes work flexibility.

meanings.definition: A device used to control the timing of flexible work schedules.
meanings.sent1: The office manager set up the flextimer to track employees' work hours.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to adjust the flextimer to match your preferred work hours.
meanings.sent3: The flextimer beeped cheerfully, reminding everyone it was time for a break.
meanings.sent4: The flextimer hummed softly, orchestrating the flow of the workday.
meanings.sent5: The flextimer's digital display glowed, guiding employees through their day.
